original: Anjou, Axel Åke, bergsingenjör, bruksägare. Ödeborg, f. 16/6/96 i Tors-hälla av Axel A. o. Maria Anjou. G. 21 m. Maja Andersson. Barn: Gun f. 22, civilekon., g. m. civiling. Kurt Sandberg, Tord 28, Gunnar 37, Kerstin 40. — Tekn. sk. i Eskilstuna, avg:ex. fr. KTH 20, stud. v. HHS 19-20. Upprep. stud:- o. aff:res. i ett 15-tal länder, bl. a. s. ikomm:kol’l. o. Jernkont. stip. Ing. v. Siirahammars Bruks A-B 20-29, avd:chef v. A-B Lindholmen-Motala, Motala verkst., 29-32, disp. fr. 32 v. o. äg. fr. 39 av Ödeborgs Bruks A-B. Styr:’led. i A-B Moderata tidn. (Bioih.-Post.), li Dadsd. tur :’traf :-för. m. m., ikomm. o. sakk :uppdr. Skr.: ett lO-tal upps. i metallurg. o. värmetekn. ämnen.
translated: Anjou, Axel Åke, mining engineer, industrialist. Born on June 16, 1896 in Tors-hälla to parents Axel A. and Maria Anjou. Married to Maja Andersson on May 21. Children: Gun (born in 1922, economist, married to civil engineer Kurt Sandberg), Tord (born in 1928), Gunnar (born in 1937), Kerstin (born in 1940). Attended Technical School in Eskilstuna, graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology in 1920 and studied at the Stockholm School of Economics in 1919-1920. Repeatedly studied and conducted business in 15 countries, including the United States and Jernkontoret. Worked as an engineer at Siirahammars Bruks AB between 1920-1929 and as department manager at AB Lindholmen-Motala, Motala Verkstäder between 1929-1932. Became the managing director in 1932 and owner of Ödeborgs Bruks AB from 1939. Served on the board of A-B Moderate Tidningar (Bioih.-Post). Also held various positions in transportation and was appointed as an expert. Wrote about ten papers on metallurgy and thermodynamics.

structured.name: Axel Åke Anjou
structured.description: Axel Åke Anjou was a Swedish mining engineer and industrialist. He was born on June 16, 1896, in Tors-hälla to parents Axel A. and Maria Anjou. He was married to Maja Andersson on May 21, 1921. He had four children: Gun, Tord, Gunnar, and Kerstin. Axel Åke Anjou attended Technical School in Eskilstuna, graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology in 1920, and studied at the Stockholm School of Economics in 1919-1920. He studied and conducted business in 15 countries, including the United States and Jernkontoret. He worked as an engineer at Siirahammars Bruks AB between 1920-1929 and as department manager at AB Lindholmen-Motala, Motala Verkstäder between 1929-1932. He became the managing director in 1932 and owner of Ödeborgs Bruks AB from 1939. He served on the board of A-B Moderate Tidningar (Bioih.-Post) and held various positions in transportation and was appointed as an expert. He wrote about ten papers on metallurgy and thermodynamics.
